title: How to Install Hebrew Keyboard on Windows

steps.headline: Insert Windows CD, click "OK", wait for the install to complete.
Click Languages Tab, go to Details.
Click the "Add" button, you will be able to select "Hebrew".
After the software is installed, you will have a keyboard tool appearing in your system task bar.
steps.description: From there, you can switch between the English and Hebrew keyboard.

tyn: Windows Install CD (or perhaps files are installed on your hard drive under c:\I386).
text: Go to Control Panel.  Click Regional and Language Options.  Click Languages tab at top.  Click "install files ... for right-to-left languages".  Click Apply.  Insert Windows CD, click "OK", wait for the install to complete.  Click Languages Tab, go to Details.  Click the "Add" button, you will be able to select "Hebrew".  After the software is installed, you will have a keyboard tool appearing in your system task bar. From there, you can switch between the English and Hebrew keyboard.
sentences: Insert Windows CD, click "OK", wait for the install to complete.
Click Languages Tab, go to Details.
Click the "Add" button, you will be able to select "Hebrew".
After the software is installed, you will have a keyboard tool appearing in your system task bar.
From there, you can switch between the English and Hebrew keyboard.
